intro: Billardiera sericea, commonly known as silky billardiera, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, fragrant white or yellowish flowers that are typically clustered in dense inflorescences. Its fruit is a small, woody capsule that splits open to release tiny seeds. Billardiera sericea is often found in open woodlands and along coastal areas, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
